Description: Reproduction mould-made pottery carinated lamp with a double-convex body, a voluted nozzle, a small plain discus and a narrow channel from the discus to the wick-hole. The shoulder is decorated with a band of radiating patterns like tapering cylinders, within a raised line following the shape of the lamp. The lamp stands on a small base-ring.
Curator's comments: Purchased at a shop in Cairo; not sold as ancient to a discerning customer. Probably moulded from an ancient example.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3495)
